title: Unable to proceed
defaultHeader: Sorry, you can’t use the online service
deathCertificateHeader: You need the death certificate or an interim death certificate
deathCertificateTranslationHeader: You need to get the death certificate translated into English
eeEstateValuedHeader: You need to check if there’s Inheritance Tax to pay
inheritanceHeader: You need to check if there’s any Inheritance Tax to pay
notOriginalHeader: You need the original will and any codicils
applyByPostHeader: You must apply for probate by post
deathCertificate: You must get the original death certificate or an interim death certificate from the coroner before you apply for probate.
deathCertificateTranslation: You must get the foreign death certificate translated into English before you apply for probate.
notInEnglandOrWales:
If the person who died didn’t live in England or Wales or intend to return here, you can’t apply for probate online.

If the person who died:

  • left a will, fill in Form PA1P (opens in a new window).
  • did not leave a will, fill in Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
ihtNotCompleted: You must work out the value of the estate and pay any Inheritance Tax before you apply for probate. You do this with HMRC (opens in a new window).
eeEstateNotValued:
Before applying for probate:
  1. Work out the estate’s value. You can use the IHT checker to get the values.
  2. Complete either forms IHT 421 and 400 or IHT 207 if the IHT checker tells you to report the estate’s values.
notDiedAfterOctober2014:
If the person died before 1 October 2014, You can’t apply for probate online

Fill in Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
notRelated:
If you’re not the husband, wife, civil partner or child of the person who died, you can’t apply for probate online.

Fill in the Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
otherApplicants:
If you want to make a joint application, you can’t apply for probate online.

Fill in Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
notOriginal:
If the will was made with a solicitor, the original may be held at their office. If the firm of solicitors that drew up the original are no longer in existence you’ll need to contact the Solicitors Regulation Authority (opens in a new window) to search their records as they may now hold the original will and codicils.

Find the original will (opens in a new window).

If you don’t have the original will and any codicils

You can’t apply for probate online.

If the person who died:
  • left a will but you do not have the original, fill in Form PA1P (opens in a new window).
  • did not leave a will, fill in Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
notExecutor:
If you’re not named as an executor or if you’re applying on behalf of someone else, you can’t apply for probate online.

Fill in Form PA1P (opens in a new window).
mentalCapacity:
If an executor is not able to make their own decisions, you can’t apply for probate online.

Fill in Form PA1P (opens in a new window) and Form PA14: Medical Certificate (opens in a new window).
divorcePlace:
You can’t use the online service if the person who died was divorced outside of England or Wales.

You can apply using the paper form instead. Download the Form PA1A (opens in a new window), print it out and fill it in.
separationPlace:
You can’t use the online service if the person who died was separated outside of England or Wales.

You can apply using the paper form instead. Download the Form PA1A (opens in a new window), print it out and fill it in.
otherRelationship:
You can’t use the online service if you’re not the spouse, civil partner or the child of the person who died.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
adoptionNotEnglandOrWales:
You can’t apply for probate online because the adoption took place outside of England or Wales.

This does not necessarily affect your eligibility to apply for probate, but we may need more information.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
spouseNotApplying: You can apply using the paper form instead. Download the Form PA1A (opens in a new window), print it out and fill it in.
childrenUnder18:
You can’t use the online service if there are children under 18 who will receive part of the estate. Children under 18 need to be represented by someone applying on their behalf.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
grandchildrenUnder18:
You can’t use the online service if there are children under 18 who will receive part of the estate. Children under 18 need to be represented by someone applying on their behalf.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the Form PA1A (opens in a new window).
